history.text: HI you have the document ?
Hey there!
Have you seen the Blind Side before?
The film with Sandra Bullock ? I have heard of it but never seen it,
Yes, that one!
Did it have good reviews ?
It's about a football player named Michael Oher
It's based off of his book. Got a 69% on Rotten Tomatoes.
But CinemaScore gave it an A+
So it is a true story ?
It is. He wrote it in 2006 but the movie came out in 2009.
I though it was a 2000  movie, the film cover what part of his life ?
He was adopted by Sean and Leigh Anne Tuohy and became a first-round pick for the Ravens.
It covers his life as a teenager, though he looked too big to be one haha
His mother was a drug addict
Did he had a disability ?
No, but he did have a poor academic record. And he would run away from every foster home he was sent to because he wanted to be with his mother.
what made him to stay with Sean and Leigh ?
Well, he befriended their son, Sean Jr., so it was probably because of that relationship.
How serious were his academic difficulties ?
Pretty serious. He scored poorly on his career aptitude test. But he ranked in the 98th percentile in "protective instincts"
What are those ?
Leigh Ann used this to teach him how to protect the quarterback as his offensive lineman.
The test is used to find where you'd work best, career-wise.
ok, I did not know that.
Yeah. He also needed a tutor, named Miss Sue, for academic help. Leigh Ann hired her

Does the football is important in the film, like  game with a close score
 ?
How does the film ends ?

I'm not sure. But he does run away because he got nervous during an interview. He meets up with this gang he got to know growing up, but fights with them because a member said something rude about Leigh Ann
It ends with him picking Ole Miss as the college he would play for because the Tuohy's went there, too.
Does he get caught by the police or he returns to Leigh Ann ?
After the fight with the gang.
He returns to Leigh Ann

Does the film show how  wel
l he does in college?
Bye

uid1response.feedback: it is not the kind of that I like. He never made any statement on how good the film was.
